dft.labels.source.name: dft.labels.source
dft.labels.source.description: The source that this label was taken from.

dft.optimade.elements.name: dft.optimade.elements
dft.optimade.elements.description: Names of the different elements present in the structure.

dft.optimade.nelements.name: dft.optimade.nelements
dft.optimade.nelements.description: Number of different elements in the structure as an integer.

dft.optimade.elements_ratios.name: dft.optimade.elements_ratios
dft.optimade.elements_ratios.description: Relative proportions of different elements in the structure.

dft.optimade.chemical_formula_descriptiv.name: dft.optimade.chemical_formula_descriptive
dft.optimade.chemical_formula_descriptiv.description:
The chemical formula for a structure as a string in a form chosen by the API
implementation.

dft.optimade.chemical_formula_reduced.name: dft.optimade.chemical_formula_reduced
dft.optimade.chemical_formula_reduced.description:
The reduced chemical formula for a structure as a string with element symbols and
integer chemical proportion numbers. The proportion number MUST be omitted if it is 1.

dft.optimade.chemical_formula_hill.name: dft.optimade.chemical_formula_hill
dft.optimade.chemical_formula_hill.description:
The chemical formula for a structure in Hill form with element symbols followed by
integer chemical proportion numbers. The proportion number MUST be omitted if it is 1.

dft.optimade.chemical_formula_anonymous.name: dft.optimade.chemical_formula_anonymous
dft.optimade.chemical_formula_anonymous.description:
The anonymous formula is the chemical_formula_reduced, but where the elements are
instead first ordered by their chemical proportion number, and then, in order left to
right, replaced by anonymous symbols A, B, C, ..., Z, Aa, Ba, ..., Za, Ab, Bb, ... and
so on.

dft.optimade.dimension_types.name: dft.optimade.dimension_types
dft.optimade.dimension_types.description:
List of three integers. For each of the three directions indicated by the three lattice
vectors (see property lattice_vectors). This list indicates if the direction is
periodic (value 1) or non-periodic (value 0). Note: the elements in this list each
refer to the direction of the corresponding entry in lattice_vectors and not
the Cartesian x, y, z directions.

dft.optimade.nsites.name: dft.optimade.nsites
dft.optimade.nsites.description: An integer specifying the length of the cartesian_site_positions property.

dft.optimade.structure_features.name: dft.optimade.structure_features
dft.optimade.structure_features.description:
A list of strings that flag which special features are used by the structure.

- disorder: This flag MUST be present if any one entry in the species list has a
chemical_symbols list that is longer than 1 element.
- unknown_positions: This flag MUST be present if at least one component of the
cartesian_site_positions list of lists has value null.
- assemblies: This flag MUST be present if the assemblies list is present.

dft.xc_functional.name: dft.xc_functional
dft.xc_functional.description: The libXC based xc functional classification used in the simulation.

dft.system.name: dft.system
dft.system.description: The system type of the simulated system.

dft.compound_type.name: dft.compound_type
dft.compound_type.description: The compound type of the simulated system.

dft.crystal_system.name: dft.crystal_system
dft.crystal_system.description: The crystal system type of the simulated system.

dft.spacegroup.name: dft.spacegroup
dft.spacegroup.description: The spacegroup of the simulated system as number.

dft.spacegroup_symbol.name: dft.spacegroup_symbol
dft.spacegroup_symbol.description: The spacegroup as international short symbol.

dft.code_name.name: dft.code_name
dft.code_name.description: The name of the used code.

dft.code_version.name: dft.code_version
dft.code_version.description: The version of the used code.

dft.n_calculations.name: dft.n_calculations
dft.n_calculations.description: Number of single configuration calculation sections

dft.n_quantities.name: dft.n_quantities
dft.n_quantities.description: Number of metainfo quantities parsed from the entry.

dft.quantities.name: dft.quantities
dft.quantities.description: All quantities that are used by this entry.

dft.searchable_quantities.name: dft.searchable_quantities
dft.searchable_quantities.description: All quantities with existence filters in the search GUI.

dft.group_hash.name: dft.group_hash
dft.group_hash.description: Hashes that describe unique geometries simulated by this code run.

dft.workflow.workflow_type.name: dft.workflow.workflow_type
dft.workflow.workflow_type.description:
The type of calculation workflow. Can be one of relaxation, elastic, phonon,
molecular dynamics.

dft.workflow.relaxation_energy_tolerance.name: dft.workflow.relaxation_energy_tolerance
dft.workflow.relaxation_energy_tolerance.description: The tolerance value in the energy between relaxation steps for convergence.

encyclopedia.material.bulk.bravais_latti.name: encyclopedia.material.bulk.bravais_lattice
encyclopedia.material.bulk.bravais_latti.description:
The Bravais lattice type in the Pearson notation, where the first
lowercase letter indicates the crystal system, and the second uppercase
letter indicates the lattice type. The value can only be one of the 14
different Bravais lattices in three dimensions.

Crystal system letters:

a = Triclinic
m = Monoclinic
o = Orthorhombic
t = Tetragonal
h = Hexagonal and Trigonal
c = Cubic

Lattice type letters:

P = Primitive
S (A, B, C) = One side/face centred
I = Body centered
R = Rhombohedral centring
F = All faces centred

encyclopedia.material.bulk.crystal_syste.name: encyclopedia.material.bulk.crystal_system
encyclopedia.material.bulk.crystal_syste.description: The detected crystal system. One of seven possibilities in three dimensions.

encyclopedia.material.bulk.has_free_wyck.name: encyclopedia.material.bulk.has_free_wyckoff_parameters
encyclopedia.material.bulk.has_free_wyck.description:
Whether the material has any Wyckoff sites with free parameters. If a
materials has free Wyckoff parameters, at least some of the atoms are
not bound to a particular location in the structure but are allowed to
move with possible restrictions set by the symmetry.

encyclopedia.material.bulk.point_group.name: encyclopedia.material.bulk.point_group
encyclopedia.material.bulk.point_group.description:
Point group in Hermann-Mauguin notation, part of crystal structure
classification. There are 32 point groups in three dimensional space.

encyclopedia.material.bulk.space_group_n.name: encyclopedia.material.bulk.space_group_number
encyclopedia.material.bulk.space_group_n.description:
Integer representation of the space group, part of crystal structure
classification, part of material definition.

encyclopedia.material.bulk.space_group_i.name: encyclopedia.material.bulk.space_group_international_short_symbol
encyclopedia.material.bulk.space_group_i.description: International short symbol notation of the space group.

encyclopedia.material.bulk.structure_pro.name: encyclopedia.material.bulk.structure_prototype
encyclopedia.material.bulk.structure_pro.description: The prototypical material for this crystal structure.

encyclopedia.material.bulk.structure_typ.name: encyclopedia.material.bulk.structure_type
encyclopedia.material.bulk.structure_typ.description:
Classification according to known structure type, considering the point
group of the crystal and the occupations with different atom types.

encyclopedia.material.bulk.strukturberic.name: encyclopedia.material.bulk.strukturbericht_designation
encyclopedia.material.bulk.strukturberic.description: Classification of the material according to the historically grown "strukturbericht".

encyclopedia.material.idealized_structur.name: encyclopedia.material.idealized_structure.lattice_parameters.a
encyclopedia.material.idealized_structur.description: Length of the first basis vector.

encyclopedia.material.idealized_structur.name: encyclopedia.material.idealized_structure.lattice_parameters.b
encyclopedia.material.idealized_structur.description: Length of the second basis vector.

encyclopedia.material.idealized_structur.name: encyclopedia.material.idealized_structure.lattice_parameters.c
encyclopedia.material.idealized_structur.description: Length of the third basis vector.

encyclopedia.material.idealized_structur.name: encyclopedia.material.idealized_structure.lattice_parameters.alpha
encyclopedia.material.idealized_structur.description: Angle between second and third basis vector.

encyclopedia.material.idealized_structur.name: encyclopedia.material.idealized_structure.lattice_parameters.beta
encyclopedia.material.idealized_structur.description: Angle between first and third basis vector.

encyclopedia.material.idealized_structur.name: encyclopedia.material.idealized_structure.lattice_parameters.gamma
encyclopedia.material.idealized_structur.description: Angle between first and second basis vector.

encyclopedia.material.idealized_structur.name: encyclopedia.material.idealized_structure.cell_volume
encyclopedia.material.idealized_structur.description:
Volume of the idealized cell. The cell volume can only be reported
consistently after idealization and may not perfectly correspond to the
original simulation cell.

encyclopedia.material.material_type.name: encyclopedia.material.material_type
encyclopedia.material.material_type.description: "Broad structural classification for the material, e.g. bulk, 2D, 1D... ",

encyclopedia.material.material_id.name: encyclopedia.material.material_id
encyclopedia.material.material_id.description: Search for a particular material by its id.

encyclopedia.material.material_name.name: encyclopedia.material.material_name
encyclopedia.material.material_name.description: Most meaningful name for a material.

encyclopedia.material.formula.name: encyclopedia.material.formula
encyclopedia.material.formula.description:
Formula giving the composition and occurrences of the elements in the
Hill notation. For periodic materials the formula is calculated fom the
primitive unit cell.

encyclopedia.material.formula_reduced.name: encyclopedia.material.formula_reduced
encyclopedia.material.formula_reduced.description:
Formula giving the composition and occurrences of the elements in the
Hill notation where the number of occurences have been divided by the
greatest common divisor.

encyclopedia.material.species_and_counts.name: encyclopedia.material.species_and_counts
encyclopedia.material.species_and_counts.description:
The formula separated into individual terms containing both the atom
type and count. Used for searching parts of a formula.

encyclopedia.material.species.name: encyclopedia.material.species
encyclopedia.material.species.description:
The formula separated into individual terms containing only unique atom
species. Used for searching materials containing specific elements.

encyclopedia.method.method_type.name: encyclopedia.method.method_type
encyclopedia.method.method_type.description: Generic name for the used methodology.

encyclopedia.method.core_electron_treatm.name: encyclopedia.method.core_electron_treatment
encyclopedia.method.core_electron_treatm.description: How the core electrons are described.

encyclopedia.method.functional_long_name.name: encyclopedia.method.functional_long_name
encyclopedia.method.functional_long_name.description: Full identified for the used exchange-correlation functional.

encyclopedia.method.functional_type.name: encyclopedia.method.functional_type
encyclopedia.method.functional_type.description: Basic type of the used exchange-correlation functional.

encyclopedia.method.group_eos_id.name: encyclopedia.method.group_eos_id
encyclopedia.method.group_eos_id.description:
A fixed length, unique identifier for equation-of-state calculations.
Only calculations within the same upload and with a method hash
available will be grouped under the same hash.

encyclopedia.method.group_parametervaria.name: encyclopedia.method.group_parametervariation_id
encyclopedia.method.group_parametervaria.description:
A fixed length, unique identifier for calculations where structure is
identical but the used computational parameters are varied. Only
calculations within the same upload and with a method hash available
will be grouped under the same hash.

encyclopedia.properties.band_gap.name: encyclopedia.properties.band_gap
encyclopedia.properties.band_gap.description:
Band gap value. If multiple spin channels are present, this value is
taken from the channel with smallest band gap value.

encyclopedia.properties.band_gap_direct.name: encyclopedia.properties.band_gap_direct
encyclopedia.properties.band_gap_direct.description:
Whether band gap is direct or not. If multiple spin channels are
present, this value is taken from the channel with smallest band gap
value.

encyclopedia.properties.electronic_band_.name: encyclopedia.properties.electronic_band_structure
encyclopedia.properties.electronic_band_.description: Reference to an electronic band structure.

encyclopedia.properties.electronic_dos.name: encyclopedia.properties.electronic_dos
encyclopedia.properties.electronic_dos.description: Reference to an electronic density of states.

encyclopedia.properties.phonon_band_stru.name: encyclopedia.properties.phonon_band_structure
encyclopedia.properties.phonon_band_stru.description: Reference to a phonon band structure.

encyclopedia.properties.phonon_dos.name: encyclopedia.properties.phonon_dos
encyclopedia.properties.phonon_dos.description: Reference to a phonon density of states.

encyclopedia.properties.thermodynamical_.name: encyclopedia.properties.thermodynamical_properties
encyclopedia.properties.thermodynamical_.description: Reference to a section containing thermodynamical properties.

encyclopedia.calculation.calculation_typ.name: encyclopedia.calculation.calculation_type
encyclopedia.calculation.calculation_typ.description: Defines the type of calculation that was detected for this entry.

encyclopedia.status.name: encyclopedia.status
encyclopedia.status.description:
The final Encyclopedia processing status for this entry. The meaning of the status is as follows:

| Status                           | Description                                                                   |
| -------------------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| `"success"`                      | Processed successfully                                                        |
| `"unsupported_material_type"`    | The detected material type is currently not supported by the Encyclopedia.    |
| `"unsupported_calculation_type"` | The detected calculation type is currently not supported by the Encyclopedia. |
| `"invalid_metainfo"`             | The entry could not be processed due to missing or invalid metainfo.          |
| `"failure"`                      | The entry could not be processed due to an unexpected exception.              |

upload_id.name: upload_id
upload_id.description: A random UUID that uniquely identifies the upload of the entry.

calc_id.name: calc_id
calc_id.description: A unique ID based on the upload id and entry's mainfile.

calc_hash.name: calc_hash
calc_hash.description: A raw file content based checksum/hash.

pid.name: pid
pid.description: The unique, sequentially enumerated, integer persistent identifier

raw_id.name: raw_id
raw_id.description: A raw format specific id that was acquired from the files of this entry

published.name: published
published.description: Indicates if the entry is published

processed.name: processed
processed.description: Indicates that the entry is successfully processed.

last_processing.name: last_processing
last_processing.description: The datetime of the last attempted processing.

nomad_version.name: nomad_version
nomad_version.description: The NOMAD version used for the last processing attempt.

nomad_commit.name: nomad_commit
nomad_commit.description: The NOMAD commit used for the last processing attempt.

parser_name.name: parser_name
parser_name.description: The NOMAD parser used for the last processing attempt.

with_embargo.name: with_embargo
with_embargo.description: Indicated if this entry is under an embargo

upload_time.name: upload_time
upload_time.description: The datetime this entry was uploaded to nomad

datasets.dataset_id.name: datasets.dataset_id
datasets.dataset_id.description:
The unique identifier for this dataset as a string. It should be
a randomly generated UUID, similar to other nomad ids.

datasets.name.name: datasets.name
datasets.name.description:
The human readable name of the dataset as string. The dataset name must be
unique for the user.

datasets.doi.name: datasets.doi
datasets.doi.description:
The optional Document Object Identifier (DOI) associated with this dataset.
Nomad can register DOIs that link back to the respective representation of
the dataset in the nomad UI. This quantity holds the string representation of
this DOI. There is only one per dataset. The DOI is just the DOI name, not its
full URL, e.g. "10.17172/nomad/2019.10.29-1".

datasets.created.name: datasets.created
datasets.created.description: The date when the dataset was first created.

datasets.name: datasets
datasets.description: Search for a particular dataset by exact name.

dataset_id.name: dataset_id
dataset_id.description: Search for a particular dataset by its id.

last_edit.name: last_edit
last_edit.description: The datetime the user metadata was edited last.

atoms.name: atoms
atoms.description: The atom labels of all atoms of the entry's material.

only_atoms.name: only_atoms
only_atoms.description: The atom labels concatenated in order-number order.

n_atoms.name: n_atoms
n_atoms.description: The number of atoms in the entry's material
